ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Interesting histories about Spain and associated recurring themes.
I learned about a variety of topics related to Spain and Spanish history, including the pre-colonial and colonial periods and modern day social movements, all while practicing Spanish.
An in-depth history of Spain.
Learning Spanish history through Spanish
I improved my Spanish and learned about some Spanish history.
I learned a lot about Spanish history and culture. As well, I had never spoken in Spanish in a professional setting. This course gave me an opportunity to develop my spanish-speaking skills.
Overview of historical and contemporary topics. Does not provide general overview, instead delves into particular subjects and aspects of Spanish culture which build a broader understanding.

I learned about the development of Spanish culture and improved my reading, writing, and speaking skills through this course. The content was very interesting and provided me with an excellent field to analyze works while developing my Spanish abilities.
I learned a broad overview of Spanish history both culturally, ethnically, and artistically through an analysis of historical texts and various forms of modern media.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: assignments were clear and fair, could take things in your own direction, lots of small group discussions
Weaknesses: classes were quite boring sometimes as it was like a lecture format without slides or a clear progression

A strength of this course is the wide variety of readings and topics it covers. It was easy to participate in class discussions and the class felt welcoming. An area for improvement is to make all of the topics flow together more cohesively. I feel like we jumped around quite a bit throughout the semester and it was difficult to find a throughline, other than the fact that all of the material was related to Spain.

Honestly, I think the classroom layout made it very hard to enjoy this course. I think that if we were organized in a U shape, and in a smaller class, we could have built up some sort of a discussion dynamic among the class, but this honestly felt more like a lecture.
The course is very interactive. Needs no improvements.
Lots of discussion which was engaging
I found most of the early material interesting, but I think the more modern topics lost my interest.
I thought it was well organized
I enjoyed the small group discussions each class to get to know classmates better and give everyone a chance to participate.
The course was well-taught and engaging. The material outside of class was carefully chosen such that it was provocative yet an efficient use of time.

Strengths: Very knowledgeable and engaging professor with thoughtful consideration of connections between syllabus themes and texts. The class was a good balance between large and small group discussions to allow for multiple levels of participation. Syllabus is very thorough and clear, which makes it easy to understand what is necessary to do well in the class. It is very straightforward, yet interesting. 

Weaknesses: Sometimes the structure of the class could get a bit repetitive.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, it's a good Spanish course and if you're interested in the history of Spain you'll learn a lot. There also aren't too many assignments at all, the weekly homeworks are just readings.
I would recommend this course to another student interested in an L5 Spanish course. The topic was interesting and accessible.
Only if they want a really easy L5 Spanish.
Yes, it is a fun and challenging L5 Spanish class.
Yes, low-stress and high-participation environment
Someone interested in a decently interesting and laid back course, yes.

Absolutely! I went in very nervous due to my ability in Spanish (I'm a native speaker but by no means the best in Spanish) and found a really welcoming environment that Professor Acosta promoted. I got the opportunity to really improve my Spanish abilities along with learning about fascinating topics in history and social studies.
Yes. This course is an excellent way to learn more about Spain and practice your Spanish.
Yes I enjoyed it
Yes. Its a good class if you want to learn about Spain and its relationship to Latin America
I would recommend this course to another student.

Yes! Professor is outstanding, the course content was highly interesting, and the assignments are carefully crafted to respect students' time while providing them with an opportunity to reflect and analyze.
Yes! Very interesting subject material with a great professor

extras.title: SPAN 246 01 - Intro to the Cultures of Spain
